definition: The likelihood that a borrower will default on obligations within a specified time horizon. The most fundamental credit risk parameter — feeds EL, capital, pricing, and provisioning.
generic_formula: Model Output → Rating → Master Scale → PD
rollup_philosophy: Weighted Average by EAD + Distribution by rating grade.
rollup_description: PD is an OBLIGOR-level attribute inherited by all facilities. At desk/portfolio/LoB we report EAD-weighted average and rating distribution.

definition: Measures a borrower's ability to service debt from operating cash flow. The most fundamental credit quality metric for income-producing lending.
rollup_description: At facility: calculated per facility. At counterparty and above: exposure-weighted average plus distribution buckets for risk appetite.

definition: Measures the relationship between the bank's exposure and the collateral value. The primary collateral coverage metric.
rollup_philosophy: Exposure-Weighted Average + Distribution by LTV bucket aligned with supervisory limits.
rollup_description: Per facility at facility level; EAD-weighted average and distribution at counterparty, desk, portfolio, LoB.

definition: Expected percentage of EAD lost upon default after recovery. Drives EL, RWA, and CECL allowance.
rollup_philosophy: EAD-weighted average; recovery model or historical by segment.
rollup_description: Obligor/collateral-level attribute; rolled up by EAD weight.

definition: Total effective interest rate (base + spread + fees) earned on exposure. Core profitability and pricing metric.
rollup_description: Calculated at facility; exposure-weighted average at counterparty, desk, portfolio, LoB.

definition: Net income attributable to segment as a percentage of allocated equity. Key performance metric for capital allocation.
rollup_philosophy: Sum income; equity allocated by methodology; ratio at each level.
rollup_description: Income and equity rolled by allocation rules; ratio computed at desk, portfolio, LoB.

definition: Probability-weighted credit loss (PD × LGD × EAD). Core risk and provisioning metric.
rollup_philosophy: Sum at facility/counterparty; sum or model at higher levels.
rollup_description: EL dollars sum from facility up; EL rate as EL/EAD at each level.

definition: Drawn exposure as a percentage of committed exposure. Key early warning and liquidity metric.
rollup_description: Facility-level ratio; at higher levels either WAvg or ratio of sums.

definition: Expected exposure at time of default. Drives RWA and EL; on- and off-balance-sheet.
rollup_description: EAD sums from facility to LoB.

definition: Exposure weighted by regulatory risk weights. Basis for capital requirements.
rollup_description: RWA sums from facility to legal entity/LoB.

definition: Exposure concentration by counterparty, industry, geography, or product. Single-name and sector limits.
rollup_description: Concentration ratios and top exposures at desk, portfolio, LoB.

definition: Movement of obligors across rating grades over time. Early warning and portfolio drift metric.
rollup_philosophy: Migration matrix at portfolio/LoB; drill to desk/counterparty.
rollup_description: Aggregate migration matrices and deterioration rates.
